revised_title: Effects of Lesions in Different Regions of the Cerebral Hemispheres
tldr: This study investigates the effects of localized brain lesions in monkeys, focusing on the occipito-angular, temporal, Rolandic, frontal, and hippocampal regions. The authors found that different lesions cause various effects on vision, hearing, motor functions, and sensory acuities. The research provides insights into the functions of specific brain regions and their impact on overall brain function.
